title: ‘Completely inadequate and inhumane’: Rep. Seth Moulton returns to ICE field office in Burlington
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Local News “Candidly, there's no excuse that they have no sleeping mats from June until now,” Moulton said.
Rep.
Seth Moulton speaks to reporters outside of the ICE field office in Burlington Monday after he toured the facility.

title: Bruins injury updates: David Pastrnak still sidelined, Arvidsson set to return
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Bruins David Pastrnak will miss his third straight game on Tuesday against the Red Wings.
David Pastrnak will miss his third-straight game on Tuesday.
(AP Photo/Nick Wass) The Boston Bruins are going to have to wait a little longer for the return of their top forward, David Pastrnak.

title: 8 takeaways from Patriots’ primetime win over the Giants
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots The Patriots have won 10 straight games for the first time since 2015.
Mike Vrabel and the Patriots took care of business on Monday night.
(Danielle Parhizkaran/Globe Staff) By Conor Ryan updated on December 1, 2025 10 minutes to read FOXBOROUGH — For the first time since 2015, the New England Patriots have a 10-game winning streak.

title: 19-year-old arrested in connection to fatal Norwood assault, DA says
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Crime Anton C.
Dowling, of Boston, was identified as the man who died from what emergency room doctors initially believed to be a gunshot wound.
Update: A 19-year-old man was arrested Monday in connection to the fatal assault of a Boston man in Norwood on Saturday.

title: South Shore man sent to prison for pandemic swimming pool scam
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Crime Steven Docchio, 59, collected over $500,000 from homeowners for work he never completed.
A Plymouth man was sentenced last month for using his swimming pool business to scam homeowners.
Steven Docchio, 59, pleaded guilty to four counts of larceny over $1,200, according to the Plymouth County District Attorney’s Office.

title: Group working on new state flag design asks for another extension
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Local News The commission released potential designs earlier this year, but says it will not be able to meet a Dec.
15 deadline for recommendations.
The Massachusetts state flag flying above the State House in Boston.

title: Somerville’s Lyndell’s Bakery is relocating after redevelopment plans
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Food News The 138-year-old shop will close April 5.
Lyndell's Bakery in Somerville.
Somerville’s oldest bakery is getting a new address — just a few doors down from its longtime home.

title: Healey releases new ‘framework’ of high school graduation requirements after voters nixed MCAS
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Education The proposal includes end-of-course tests administered by the state, as well as capstone projects and financial literacy lessons.
Governor Maura Healey shares a laugh with second graders at A.
C.
